Name: lat
Comments: Latitude, in decimal degrees, south is negative.

Name: lon
Comments: Longitude, in decimal degrees, west is negative.

Name: usehorizon
Comments: Calculate taking into account shadows from high horizon. Value of 1 for "yes".

Name: userhorizon
Comments: Height of the horizon at equidistant directions around the point of interest, in degrees. Starting at north and moving clockwise. The series '0,10,20,30,40,15,25,5' would mean the horizon height is 0° due north, 10° for north-east, 20° for east, 30° for south-east, etc.

Name: raddatabase
Comments: Name of the radiation database (DB): "PVGIS-SARAH" for Europe, Africa and Asia or "PVGIS-NSRDB" for the Americas between 60°N and 20°S, "PVGIS-ERA5" and "PVGIS-COSMO" for Europe (including high-latitudes), and "PVGIS-CMSAF" for Europe and Africa (will be deprecated). The default DBs are PVGIS-SARAH, PVGIS-NSRDB and PVGIS-ERA5 based on the chosen location (see Figure xx).

Name: startyear
Comments: First year of the output of monthly averages. Availability varies with the  of the radiation DB chosen. The default value is the first year of the DB.

Name: endyear
Comments: Final year of the output of monthly averages. Availability varies with the  of the radiation DB chosen. The default value is the last year of the DB.

Name: horirrad
Comments: Output horizontal plane irradiation. Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: optrad
Comments: Output annual optimal angle plane irradiation. Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: selectrad
Comments: Output irradiation on plane of selected inclination. Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: mr_dni
Comments: Output direct normal irradiation. Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: d2g
Comments: Output monthly values of the ratio of diffuse to global radiation (horizontal plane). Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: avtemp
Comments: Output monthly average values of daily (24h) temperature. Value of 1 for "yes". All other values (or no value) mean "no".

Name: outputformat
Comments: Type of output. Choices are: "csv" for the normal csv output with text explanations, "basic" to get only the data output with no text, and "json".

Name: browser
Comments: Use this with a value of "1" if you access the web service from a web browser and want to save the data to a file.
